name: Hard Basketbrawl 2004 Quiz / Test | NBA by Season | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which Piston player started the fight that ended in the riot?
questions.explanation:
Ben Wallace.

	Ben Wallace retalliated to an uncalled for hard foul by punching Ron Artest in the face.

questions.correct: Artest got hit with a beer
questions.explanation:
Artest got hit with a beer.

	A fan threw a beer at Artest from the stands. Artest reacted to it, inciting the riot.

questions.text: How many games was Artest suspended for?
questions.explanation:
73.

	Artest was served with the longest suspension, for on court fighting in modern sports history. He received a 73+ game suspension. The rest of the regular season (73) and the playoffs.

questions.text: How many players in all were suspended?
questions.explanation:
9.

	Nine players in all were suspended, five for Indiana and four for Detroit. Ron Artest, Reggie Miller, Jermaine O'Neal, Stephon Jackson, and Anthony Johnson for the Pacers. Ben Wallace, Chauncey Billups, Elden Campbell, and Derrick Coleman for Detroit.

questions.text: Which Piston received the longest suspension?
options: They are all the same length
questions.explanation:
Ben Wallace.

	Wallace received a six game suspension, the rest of the Pistons received a game each.

questions.text: Jermaine O'Neal received the sixth longest suspension in league history. How long was it?
questions.explanation:
25 games.

	He received the sixth longest suspension in league history, but it was the third longest on his team following this incident in question.

questions.text: Stephon Jackson had played only nine games for Indiana before being suspended. Which team did he play for before coming to Indiana?
questions.explanation:
Atlanta.

	Jackson played for Atlanta in the 2003-04 season. Before that he split his previous three season with San Antonio and New Jersey. Jackson averaged 18.1 points for the Hawks in 2003-04.

questions.text: In all, how many games were all of the players on both teams suspended for, not including the playoffs?
questions.explanation:
143.

	Indiana's five players received a total of 134 games of suspension, while Detroit's four players received a total of nine games of suspension.

questions.text: During his illustrious career, how many times had Reggie Miller been suspended prior to this incident?
questions.explanation:
1.

	Miller has spent his career as an upstanding NBA player. He was suspended only once(for a single game) prior to this, his 18th season in the NBA. Also, he had missed only 36 games for any other reason prior to this season in 2004.

questions.text: Who was the arbitrator, that the appeal of the suspensions were made to?
questions.explanation:
David Stern.

	David Stern, NBA commissioner and the person that originally gave out the suspensions, was also ironically the arbitrator.
